metadata.ttm:title: Goals
metadata.ttm:desc: The Goals section asks you to state the percentage of the Contract value that you intend to designate for each of the various Subcontracting categories. These values are applied to Small Business types according to the designations for which Subcontractors may qualify, and then defined over the Base year, and all Option years of the Contract.

div.p: The Goals section is where you state what percent of
the contract value you intend to designate for
the various subcontracting categories.
Begin by clicking "Add" for the base year You will
need to enter the "Total Dollars to be
Subcontracted", which will be the sum of your "Large
Business Goals" and "All Small" goals.
When filling out the Large Business goals, you will
find the system will automatically complete
either the percentage or dollar amount, depending
on which you choose to fill out.
This will help you along the way ensure you are
doing the proper math and that everything adds up.
Next fill in the Small Business Type goals.
These goals should be thought of independently,
not as values that equal your All Small Business
goal as there may be instances where
subcontractors qualify for multiple designations,
each of the Small Business Types could add up beyond
the total of the All Small Business.
When you are finished click "Save", to return to
the goals screen.
You will see the subcontracting values
reflected in the Goals chart.
If you wish to fill any subsequent Option periods
with the same goals as the Base year, click the
"Copy" link.
Otherwise you can fill them out manually by
clicking Add and following the previous steps.
Select the desired Option Periods and click Copy You
will notice your goals reflected in the chart.
On the next section, select which Supplies or
Services are to be subcontracted by clicking
Add.
Identify the Supply or Service to be
subcontracted and select which type of
subcontractor will be leveraged.
When you have finished click "Save."
The supply or service will appear on the chart,
continue adding as many relevant supplies or
services as needed.
For Section C, explain how your goals were
established and justify any particularly low
goals, using evidence such as historical data,
experience, or research.
For Section D, enter a detailed description on
how your company plans to identify potential
partners to meet your subcontracting goals.
Finally state whether indirect costs, such as
overhead, administrative costs, benefits, etc, have
been included in the subcontracting goals.
If they have been accounted for, explain the
methodology used to calculate these costs in
the textbox below.
When you are finished click Save then Next When
you are finished click "Save and Continue" to
move on to the Program Administrator section.
